Vulnerabilities: Lack of rate limiting or account lockout

Steps.Description: Perform web application reconnaissance to identify the password reset functionality.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker is trying to find the password reset functionality on the web application.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker explores the web application to locate the password reset functionality.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker finds the password reset functionality on the web application.

Steps.Description: Research information about Alan Turing to answer the security questions.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker needs to gather information about Alan Turing to answer the security questions correctly.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker searches for information about Alan Turing online to find the answers to the security questions.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker gathers the necessary information to answer the security questions.

Steps.Description: Submit the correct answers to the security questions.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that submitting the correct answers to the security questions will bypass the password reset functionality.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker fills out the password reset form with the correct answers to the security questions.
StepDetails.Result: The password reset functionality is successfully bypassed, granting access to the account.
